functions¶

(thermal_history.stable_layer_models.leeds_thermal.routines.functions)

buffett_seagle_10_growth(r, c, conc_l, dc_dr)[source]¶

Calculate the layer interface movement using the method of Buffett and Seagle (2010) and regrid the solution.

Parameters:

  • r – radial grid

  • c – Light element mass fraction on grid

  • conc_l – Mass fraction of isentropic region

  • dc_dr – Mass fraction gradient at interface in the layer

Returns:

Regridded solutions (radius, temperature, mass fraction)

Return type:

r,T,c

change_domain_size(X_rel, r, s_new, resolution)[source]¶

Change the domain size with linear interpolation

Parameters:

  • X_rel – Property (array) or properties (tuple of arrays) to be regridded

  • r – radial grid of property/properties

  • s_new – new radius of the layer interface

  • resolution – tuple of resolution parameters (number of grid points/meter, minimum number of points, maximum number of points)

Returns:

New radial grid and tuple of arrays with regridded properties

Return type:

r_new, a

cubic_fit(x1, x2, f_x1, f_x2, f_x1_prime, f_x2_prime)[source]¶

Fit a cubic equation f(x) = m1*x^3 + m2*x^2 + m3*x + m4 Defined conditions are f(x1), f(x2) and f’(x1), f’(x2)

determine_strat_type(ub_type_c, ub_c, ADR, T, Ta, conc_l, E_T, prm)[source]¶

AI algorithms (lots of ‘if’ statements) to determine the dominant type of stratification: thermal or chemical

Parameters:

  • ub_type_T – Type of upper boundary condition type for the thermal solution. Either 0 (fixed value) or 1 (fixed gradient)

  • ub_T – Value for the upper boundary condition for temperature

  • ub_type_c – Type of upper boundary condition type for the chemical solution. Either 0 (fixed value) or 1 (fixed gradient)

  • ub_c – Value for the upper boundary condition for composition

  • ADR – Adiabatic ratio, the ratio of CMB heat flux to the adiabatic heat flux

  • T – Temperature values on radial grid

  • Ta – Adiabatic temperature values on radial grid

  • conc_l – Mass fraction of light element in isentropic region

  • E_T – Entrainent parameters for thermal solution

  • prm – parameter class

Returns:

String containing the type of dominant stratification (‘thermal’, ‘chemical’ or ‘none’)

Return type:

strat

primordial_layer_init(conc_l, dc, dc_dr_s, r)[source]¶

Initial compositional profile within a primordial layer

Parameters:

  • conc_l – Mass fraction of light element in isentropic region

  • dc – Change in mass fraction of light element across layer

  • dc_dr_s – gradient in mass fraction at the base of the layer to satisfy

  • r – radial grid within layer to calculate mass fraction on

Returns:

Array with mass fraction values on the radial grid

Return type:

c

retreat_layer(r, T, c, Tcen, conc_l, adiabat_poly, resolution, alpha_T, alpha_c, density_grad_limit=0)[source]¶

Regrid the solution back to the radius that satisfies the stability conditions

Parameters:

  • r – radial grid

  • T – Temperature on grid

  • c – Light element mass fraction on grid

  • Tcen – Temperature at r=0

  • conc_l – Mass fraction of isentropic region

  • adiabat_poly – Radial polynomials for adiabatic temperature

  • resolution – tuple of resolution parameters (number of grid points/meter, minimum number of points, maximum number of points)

  • alpha_T – Thermal expansivity

  • alpha_c – Chemical expansivity

  • density_grad_limit – Upper limit on the potential density gradient required for stability

Returns:

Regridded solutions (radius, temperature, mass fraction)

Return type:

r_new,T_new,c_new
